official_title: A bill to establish the Commission on the Centennial Review of the Civil Service.
short_title: Commission on the Centennial Review of the Civil Service

summary.text: (Measure passed Senate, amended) Commission on the Centennial Review of the Civil Service - Establishes the Commission on the Centennial Review of the Civil Service. Directs the Commission to: (1) study the history and development of the U.S. civil service system over the last 100 years; (2) study other civil service systems used in the United States and other nations; and (3) make recommendations for continuing or improving the performance of the Federal civil service system. Directs the Commission to consider: (1) employee pay and benefits, personnel practices, and the labor-management relations system under the civil service system; (2) methods to improve and expand the training and development of Federal directors, managers, and supervisors; and (3) ways to maintain high morale among Federal employees. Authorizes the Commission to hold hearings, take testimony, and issue subpoenas as it considers appropriate. Requires the Commission to submit a final report containing its findings, conclusions, and recommendations for legislation or administrative action to the President and Congress within the first ten days of the second session of the Ninety-ninth Congress. Terminates the Commission 90 days after it submits such report. Authorizes appropriations.
